metadata.title: CVE-2020-36323 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
In the standard library in Rust before 1.52.0, there is an optimization forjoining strings that can cause uninitialized bytes to be exposed (or theprogram to crash) if the borrowed string changes after its length ischecked.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-36323` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libstd-rust-1.53 - 1.53.0+dfsg1+llvm-4ubuntu1
rust-all - 1.53.0+dfsg1+llvm-4ubuntu1
rust-clippy - 1.53.0+dfsg1+llvm-4ubuntu1
rust-gdb - 1.53.0+dfsg1+llvm-4ubuntu1
rust-lldb - 1.53.0+dfsg1+llvm-4ubuntu1
rust-src - 1.53.0+dfsg1+llvm-4ubuntu1
rustc - 1.53.0+dfsg1+llvm-4ubuntu1
rustfmt - 1.53.0+dfsg1+llvm-4ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: rustc package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.53.0+dfsg1+llvm-4ubuntu1').
